article.headline: Robert Morris 70, Sacred Heart 65
article.story: FAIRFIELD, Conn. (AP) -- Chaz McCrommon scored 19 points and Robert Morris held off a second-half rally to beat Sacred Heart 70-65 in a Northeast Conference game Thursday night. McCrommon scored 11 in the first half, during which Robert Morris (11-13, 8-6 NEC) scored 42 points and shot 55 percent. Derek Coleman added 14 points and Christopher Gooden scored 11. McCrommon gave RMU a 62-61 lead with a driving layup and later iced the game with two free throws. The Colonials snapped a three-game losing streak. Sacred Heart (3-20, 2-12), meanwhile, dropped its fifth in a row. The Pioneers were led by Joey Henley, who scored 15 of his 19 in the second half. Mike Parker added 13 points. Robert Morris led by 13 at halftime, but the Pioneers recovered in the second half to take a three-point lead. Sacred Heart led by two with 4:38 to play, but the Pioneers didn't score for the next 4:06.
